publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.article-title: The Economics of National Security Association:
title-group.subtitle: A New Partner for Promoting Research

bio.p: Molly Valdes-Dapena is a research assistant in the Cost Analysis and Research Division of the Institute for Defense Analyses. Ms. Valdes-Dapena, who recently received her BA in economics from the University of Virginia, works to interweave her interest in public economics and her fascination with the defense industry through projects on topics ranging from defense acquisition to resource allocation processes in the national security industry. She hopes to continue her work in defense and her education in economics through the pursuit of a PhD in economics at one of the nation’s leading research institutions.

ref.mixed-citation: Asch, B. J., Miller III, J. C., and Warner, J. T. 2012. Economics and the All-Volunteer Military Force, in Better Living Through Economics, Siegfried, J. J., ed. Harvard University Press, 253-269.
